details.name: description
details.old_value:
This has always bugged me throughout my entire ET career. The covert-op has a major disadvantage in fights, because he can't fully use his primary. 
While all other classes can empty the entire primary and then switch to secondary, a covert-op needs to keep the overheating in mind. 
Once he is stuck in overheating the battle is lost.

While overheating you should be able to still switch to your secondary. It just doesn't make sense to not be able to.

Related to: 
#508
#794

journals.notes: This is done on purpose. The idea is to counteract the better accuracy/silent weapon of covops, by giving them the additional overheating  parameter to handle. Either learn to control overheating or switch to secondary before it's too late.
Exactly, just like the fact you can't switch while reloading. This is part of the gameplay, not a bug.

Meh.
But could we change the visualization of the overheating then? It's quite hard to focus the cross-hair on someone, while trying to estimate the progress of a jittering bar.
Is it possible to make the progress smooth as long as the trigger is being held?


But isn't the higher accuracy and silence of the weapon already effectively countered by the fact that you can only get half a magazine through? Both things seem a bit too nerfy to me^^

Usually people playing it will do a click-per-shot, or just have it pressed quickly because they only make headshots; short controlled bursts, and you never overheat it :)

This is an habit you take if you really want to use the Sten.
Hm, I guess I'm not made for sneaky covert-op play then.
It's indeed a very different playstyle. Always impressive to watch a good covops using sten.
